name: 李老师不是你老师
content: I spent some time reading these 100,000 reposts and found that almost the vast majority of people who forwarded them did not believe the notice. From a few years ago when there was an emergency, netizens actively tagged Jiangning Public Security Online to "seek reversal", to today when people no longer believe the so-called "white text on a blue background", how did the credibility of the Chinese government collapse step by step?

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: I think one of the important reasons is that in the past few years, when responding to emergencies, the government has been too eager to calm the incidents as quickly as possible and has ignored the truth. As a result, there have been too many incidents where the government's rumor-refuting was actually debunked, such as the frequent rumor-refuting prophecy during the epidemic and the god-level operation of five notices contradicting each other in the Iron Chain Girl incident. The government's perfunctory attitude is obvious, so that even if it is the truth, people are unwilling to believe it.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Another video about the Lianzhou incident can make a correction to the entire incident:
According to the girl’s self-narration in the video
1. She is not a junior high school student, but she has had four children with this man since she was in the second or thirteenth year of junior high school, and all four children were raised by the girl
2. She was not raped in the park, but beaten. And domestic violence was frequent, and the girl committed suicide many times because of this.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: How should I put it? I thought it was a rumor-busting story, but it turned out to be a more terrifying story.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A friend in the circle of friends received a fraud call, and within a few minutes the anti-fraud APP sent a text message to remind him to be careful of being deceived. Then the police called to praise him for his high awareness, but he still had to go downstairs to receive anti-fraud education. The whole thing made me very confused. How does the anti-fraud APP work? If you knew it was a fraud call in advance, why didn't you intercept it directly? If you didn't know it in advance, how did you find out it was a fraud in such a short time?

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @torontobigface Apart from anything else, a dish passed between so many people must have been tested for nucleic acid at least three times before it entered their mouths
